chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of a Child, Repeated Acts w/ High Probability of Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:09 AM Defendant Kelly A Buckner in court with attorney Matt Last.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Department Detective Steven Guth sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Gordon.  Cross examination by Attorney Last.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Last objects to bind over without argument and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen.
Hearing on March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A (outside of the work enviroment and only what is required of her for work purposes)/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No physical discipline of any child.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18 except her daughter.    Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.    Receipt of Passport surrendered to the Court.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant allowed one visit to the property with law enforcement present to obtain her personal possessions.  Defendant can go to the residence if victim A and witness A are not at the residence.

03:21 PM Defendant Kelly A Buckner in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia, as a friend of the court.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant given a petition for the appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
